subject: Re: Confused about J2EEUnit, JunitEE and JUnitServlet
msgSnippet: Hi, I faced the same a month ago. After trying out both J2EEUnit and JUnitEE, I chose JUnitEE. There isn t much difference actually. Maybe cos I use Orion App
messageBody:
Hi,

I faced the same a month ago. After trying out both J2EEUnit and
JUnitEE, I chose JUnitEE.
There isn't much difference actually. Maybe cos I use Orion App
server, it was natural for me to use JUnitEE.

//Sharmila.

--- In junit@y..., "Gael Marziou" <gael_marziou@h...> wrote:
> Hello,
>
> I am in the process of unit testing some classes on server side.
> Having a quick look around, I found 3 extensions to junit that
could
> fit: J2EEUnit, JunitEE and JUnitServlet.
>
> It's not clear whether those are competitors or complementary.
>
> J2EEUnit seems to be kind of blessed by JUnit by being referenced
> from JUnit home page.
>
> Any feedback would be appreciated, my main concern is to choose the
> right one to invest time in learning and using it.
>
> Thanks,
>
> Gael
